comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Carleton L. Brownson, professor of Greek, formerly of the American School of Classics at Athens, and later instructor in Latin at Yale.  He seems to have done a number of translations of Greek texts.

comment.author: 57295681@N00
comment._content: @ pennylrichardsco and others who give context to these photos - thanks very much for putting in the time to research it! It really brings the photos to life!

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carleton_Lewis_Brownson

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: pennylrichardsca: I'll join mcsheeryp in thanking you for the identifying information.  In checking Prints & Photographs Division collections that are not online, I found a matching image identifying him in a handwritten caption as "Carleton L. Brownson, Dean, the College of the City of New [York]" (last word cut off--must have been on a larger mount at one time) and with a stamped credit to "Alman & Co, 590 Fifth Ave., N.Y."  We'll add information to the description for the Bain negative when we next update the record.
